meanings.definition: The practice of insuring again by transferring part of the risk to another insurer.
meanings.sent1: Many insurance companies use reinsurances to protect themselves from large losses.
meanings.sent2: The reinsurances helped spread the risk among multiple insurers.
meanings.sent3: The party was so good at reinsurances, they could insure anything, even a flying elephant!
meanings.sent4: In the world of insurance, reinsurances are like a safety net, catching risks before they fall.
meanings.sent5: Learning about reinsurances is like discovering a secret shield against financial storms.

meanings.definition: The amount of risk transferred in a reinsurance agreement.
meanings.sent1: The reinsurances in the agreement were carefully calculated to ensure balanced risk distribution.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the reinsurances involved in the deal is crucial for accurate risk assessment.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected increase in reinsurances made the insurance broker do a double-take.
meanings.sent4: The reinsurances acted as a safety valve, releasing pressure from the main insurer.
meanings.sent5: The reinsurances were like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly to protect against potential losses.
